content:
Attachment III-A Audit Report No. A-1711
COUNCIL FOR UNITED STATES AID EXECUTIVE YUAN
Reference No. C2-62-1433
MEMORANDUM May 8, 1962
To
: Mr. H. F. Shambarger, Controller, US AID/C
From : C. C. Chang, Chief , Second Division, CUSA
Subject : Excess Equipment Project No. 99-471
Referring to a draft Audit Report No. 4-1711 which was forwarded to us for clearance, we wish to make the following comments with regard to the subject project:
(1) "Records" BES is the handling agency for excess equipment procured abroad and keeps necessary records. On the part of CUS/., matters pertaining to this project are handled by its various offices in accordance with their respective functions. The Second Division of CUSA handles programming and allocation and has records as required; similarly do the other offices.
(2) "Long-idled items" During a period about one year ago, sizable quantities of excess supplies which had not been requested or were in excess of the requested quantities were shipped from USA under PIO/C 00043 and PIO/C 80450, the procurement agency of both PIO/C's being GSA/FSS/FUU. Efforts had constantly been made to utilize these unexpected arrivals to the best advantage. Major portion has thus been allocated or sold though there is still a portion which remains in BES yard and is being under sale by CTC. Lately, SDC has approached CTC for purchase of some of these supplies and delivery will be made upon payment. The quantities of unsold items have been consider ably reduced through months of efforts by relevant offices.
(3) "BES storage condition" The storage condition at BES yard has been improved as practicable. As the excess equipment are stored in BES yard only for a short period and consist mainly of heavy construction equipment which can stand weathering, no construction of warehouse for their storage is ever contemplated.
(4) "BES as recipient" Besides to replace PIO/C items, the principal objective of this project has been to improve the quality and speed of construction work under aid projects. BES in fact is the only construction enterprise here using large quantities of heavy construction equipment and has continuously under taken construction work under aid projects. Hence, BES is eligible recipient and has been listed as such under Project Agreements. The first batch of excess equipment from Japan was chosen on the spot by BES jointly with Mission/J.G.White personnel and BES was the
國史饭 Academia Historica

(1) "Records" BES is the handling agency for excess equipment procured abroad and keeps necessary records. On the part of CUS/., matters pertaining to this project are handled by its various offices in accordance with their respective functions. (2) "Long-idled items" During a period about one year ago, sizable quantities of excess supplies which had not been requested or were in excess of the requested quantities were shipped from USA under PIO/C 00043 and PIO/C 80450, the procurement agency of both PIO/C's being GSA/FSS/FUU.
